links.title: ECR 02.24.2018 - EYE Chart Radio
links.description: This week we have Chuck Joiner from the MacVoices Podcast. We discuss Apple being on the top of FastCompany's Most Innovative Companies List and the coinciding interview that went along with that distinction. We also talk about Apple wanting to be in a bit more control over the metal that is necessary to make the batteries that make their devices run; cobalt.

message.body: Photos of purported 'iPhone X Plus' display assembly reveal LG manufacturing http://appleinsider.com/articles/18/02/25/photos-of-purported-iphone-x-plus-display-assembly-reveal-lg-manufacturing Alleged new 6.5 inch iPhone X. $AAPL

links.title: Photos of purported 'iPhone X Plus' display assembly reveal LG manufacturing
links.description: A pair of images posted to a Chinese blog on Saturday purportedly offer a first look at Apple's next-generation "iPhone X Plus" handset, a 6.5-inch device rumored to see release later this year. According to a MacX forum post, the images originate from LG Display's manufacturing facility in Vietnam, where the company is reportedly producing a trial run of "iPhone X Plus" screens for Apple.

links.description: There is probably no other investment portfolio more closely watched than that of Warren Buffett. His remarkable track record of outperforming the S&P 500 is unmatched. messages.body: $AAPL https://www.cnbc.com/2018/02/25/samsung-galaxy-s9-launches-at-mobile-world-congress-specs-price.html

links.title: Samsung launches the Galaxy S9 smartphone to take on Apple's iPhone X
links.description: Samsung launched its flagship S9 smartphone on Sunday with an improved camera and augmented reality (AR) capabilities to challenge Apple's iPhone X. The South Korean electronics giant released two versions of the device: a 5.9-inch S9 and 6.2-inch S9+. Both feature an almost bezeless display that was introduced on the S8 last year.

messages.body: Silicon Valley is so expensive that employees can't afford to live near the office https://yhoo.it/2sVEwMB $AAPL $FB $GOOGL $GOOG $TWTR

links.title: Silicon Valley is so expensive that even Facebook and Apple employees can't afford to live near the office
links.description: Silicon Valley's housing crisis is serious. A new report from Open Listings reveals that workers at five major tech companies, including Apple, Facebook, and Google, would have to spend over 28% of their salary to pay a monthly mortgage on a home near work.
